new_messages.content: Please analyze and update today's (2025-10-31 12:00:00) positions.

Here‚Äôs today‚Äôs portfolio analysis and update, as of 2025-10-31 12:00:00.

Step 1 ‚Äî Read yesterday‚Äôs positions (starting holdings and cash)
- Positions:
  - NVDA: 11 shares
  - AVGO: 5 shares
  - MU: 7 shares
- Cash: $169.37

Step 2 ‚Äî Use today‚Äôs prices to update valuation
- Prices used:
  - NVDA: $203.775
  - AVGO: $371.57
  - MU: $222.42
- Position market values:
  - NVDA: 11 x 203.775 = $2,241.53
  - AVGO: 5 x 371.57 = $1,857.85
  - MU: 7 x 222.42 = $1,556.94
- Cash: $169.37
- Total portfolio value: $2,241.53 + $1,857.85 + $1,556.94 + $169.37 = $5,825.69

Step 3 ‚Äî Updated portfolio weights (based on today‚Äôs valuation)
- NVDA: ~38.46%
- AVGO: ~31.88%
- MU: ~26.72%
- Cash: ~2.91%

Step 4 ‚Äî Market/news and sentiment scan (X, Reddit, and news)
- AI capex remains very strong:
  - CNBC (2025-10-31): Big Tech (MSFT, GOOGL, AMZN, META) collectively lifting AI capex guidance; annualized spend now projected >$380B. This reinforces long-run demand for AI infrastructure suppliers (NVDA, AVGO, MU).
- Broadcom (AVGO):
  - Investor site Q3 FY25 results: revenue up 22% Y/Y; Q4 guidance implies continued strong growth, consistent with AI networking demand. Positive for AVGO‚Äôs Ethernet/optical franchises.
  - Additional tailwind: public announcements in October of strategic AI accelerator/network collaborations in the industry (supports demand for AVGO connectivity and custom silicon).
- Micron (MU):
  - Industry commentary highlights continued HBM3E ramp, strong pricing, and competitive power-efficiency positioning in HBM. Tailwind from AI memory intensity remains a core thesis.
- NVIDIA (NVDA):
  - 2025 expected to be a major Blackwell ramp per industry trackers (e.g., TrendForce reporting dominance of Blackwell in 2025 high-end shipments). Earlier packaging concerns from 2024 are in the rear-view; 2025 supply expected to scale.
- Macro:
  - Post-FOMC (Oct 29) backdrop is constructive enough for risk assets; no immediate shift that would derail AI capex trends.
- Social sentiment (X/Reddit):
  - Direct access was limited for some threads; however, the prevailing discourse continues to emphasize AI infrastructure buildout and supplier strength. No acute negative catalysts surfaced today in our scan.

Step 5 ‚Äî Decision and actions
- Assessment:
  - The portfolio is concentrated in AI infrastructure beneficiaries (NVDA, AVGO, MU) and is aligned with the strongest secular tailwind in markets.
  - Fresh news flow supports maintaining exposure: hyperscaler capex up; AVGO guidance solid; MU HBM ramp trending well; NVDA product cycle (Blackwell) underpinning demand into 2025.
  - Cash available ($169) is not sufficient to add a meaningful position in our core targets without selling. I do not see a compelling reason to trim core holdings today given supportive fundamentals and news.
- Action today:
  - No trades. Maintain current allocations.
  - Rationale: Portfolio is close to our informal target mix (NVDA ~40%, AVGO ~35%, MU ~25%); today‚Äôs prices and news do not justify rebalancing or rotating away.

Key risks to monitor
- AI capex moderation risk in 2026+; watch for any signs of digestion after large 2025 spend.
- Supply chain constraints (especially HBM capacity) that could affect MU or NVDA shipment timing.
- Regulatory/export factors affecting data center GPU shipments.
- Valuation sensitivity to broader market/interest rate shifts.

Upcoming catalysts to watch
- Next earnings/guidance updates from NVDA, AVGO, MU.
- Any incremental capex commentary from MSFT/GOOGL/AMZN/META (sustainability of 2025/2026 spend).
- HBM4 roadmap updates and capacity expansions.

Summary
- Portfolio value: $5,825.69
- Weights: NVDA ~38.46%, AVGO ~31.88%, MU ~26.72%, Cash ~2.91%
- Today‚Äôs action: Hold. No changes to positions.

<FINISH_SIGNAL>

News:

*   OpenAI and Broadcom will co-develop systems that include accelerators and Ethernet solutions from Broadcom for scale-up and scale-out

OpenAI will design the accelerators and systems, which will be developed and deployed in partnership with Broadcom. By designing its own chips and systems, OpenAI can embed what it‚Äôs learned from developing frontier models and products directly into the hardware, unlocking new levels of capability and intelligence. URL: https://www.cnbc.com/2025/10/31/tech-ai-google-meta-amazon-microsoft-spend.html
Title: Tech's $380 billion splurge: This quarter's winners and losers of the AI spending boom
Description: With the largest cloud and internet companies reporting results this week, it's clear that spending on artificial intelligence is only increasing.
Publish Time: 2025-10-31T13:23:04+0000
Content: Mark Zuckerberg, chief executive officer of Meta Platforms Inc., during the Meta Connect event in Menlo Park, California, US, on Wednesday, Sept. 17, 2025.

David Paul Morris | Bloomberg | Getty Images

Tech's internet giants have made it through earnings season, and they offered a consistent message to Wall Street: [Artificial intelligence](https://www.cnbc.com/ai-effect/) investments are only getting bigger.

[Alphabet](https://www.cnbc.com/quotes/GOOGL/), [Meta](https://www.cnbc.com/quotes/META/), [Microsoft](https://www.cnbc.com/quotes/MSFT/) and [Amazon](https://www.cnbc.com/quotes/AMZN/) each lifted their guidance for capital expenditures and now collectively expect that number to reach more than $380 billion this year.

Microsoft's forecast was for fiscal 2026, which ends in June.

The companies are racing to build out infrastructure for what they say is virtually limitless demand for AI services.

Meanwhile, a growing number of skeptics are voicing concerns that these historic ...

Title: Nvidia (NVDA) Q1 2025 Earnings Call Transcript

Content: NVDA earnings call for the period ending March 31, 2024.

![Image 1: Logo of jester cap with thought bubble.](https://g.foolcdn.com/image/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fg.foolcdn.com%2Fmisc-assets%2Ffool-transcripts-logo.png&w=828&op=resize)
